then the packages are broken. use debian ones ;)
well, at uninstalling VHCS, these files probably were deleted - i had them before :/
what server did you get the package from, and what are the installed files according to synaptic?
I'm using apt-get and I don't know what package they came from, they just were there I guess (some package installed at setup)
though, apt-file tells me I need to reinstall libapache2-mod-php4, but then I need to reinstall whole PHP and I did that lots of times before .
then do "apt-cache show libapache2-mod-php4"
you could try php5 instead.
no, because this program wants me to have PHP4... :(
oh I see
otherwise I'd been switched at the beginning of this day already .
look at this output of remove :
It may be a bug in the package installation scripts that come with the package
so how do I get the files now !! ... .
you could manually download the package from a server and run dpkg -x libapache2-mod-php4 ./
but it will of course only work if everything else works ;)
